name: David Letterman
monologue: There’s already talk that Ricky Gervais won’t be invited back to the Golden Globes. Hey, welcome to the club.

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Ways To Mispronounce Reince Priebus

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: Arnold Schwarzenegger says that being governor of California cost him at least $200 million in lost movie roles. Movie-goers everywhere say it was worth it.

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: Brett Favre has officially filed his retirement papers with the NFL. He was able to do it quickly by pulling up to the NFL’s “Brett Favre Retirement” window.

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: Starbucks is going to offer an extra large drink size known as “trenta.” It’s an Italian word meaning “six more ounces of burnt coffee.”

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: A woman in Los Angeles gave birth to healthy baby on the shoulder of the 605 freeway. It’s amazing what people will do just to use the car pool lane.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Top honors went to the Facebook movie, “The Social Network.” It won because it got the most "likes."

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Two credit rating firms say the U.S. credit rating has remained at AAA. Aren’t we like $14 trillion in debt? Wouldn’t “LOL” be more like it?

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Starbucks introduced its biggest drink ever: the 31-ounce “trenta.” The cost: $1 million.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Congratulations to the new Miss America, 17-year-old Teresa Scanlan. You can tell she’s still a teenager by her talent — texting while driving.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Piers Morgan’s show premiered on CNN, and his first guest was Oprah Winfrey. That lady came across as warm and inviting — and Oprah did OK too.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Piers did a great job differentiating himself from Larry King. He didn’t wear suspenders and he stayed awake for the whole show.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Apparently, Piers Morgan made a bet with Oprah on who would be the first to get Michael Vick on their show. That’s not so hard. Just lure him in with a trail of puppies.
